PagerDuty: The tool we use to send alerts to on callers.
Azure Dev Ops: I don't think this one works.
The: Denotes one or more people or things already mentioned or assumed to be common knowledge.
ACP: Access Care Planning is a product for carers and careworkers.
ACP Server: The ACP product for desktop, go here for more: https://confluence.accessnet.co.uk/display/PSMOB/Access+Care+Planning+Home
Server: A computer or device that provides resources or services to other computers or devices.
release: The action of making a product or information available to the public or to a particular group.
pipeline: A series of actions or steps that are executed in a specific order to accomplish a particular task.
been: Past participle of 'be', used to indicate that something has happened or existed in the past.
converted: Changed or transformed from one form, state, or system to another.
to: Expressing motion or direction toward a particular location or point.
.yml: A file extension for YAML (Yet Another Markup Language), commonly used for defining configurations and pipelines.
in: Expressing the situation of something being enclosed or surrounded by something else.
order: A command or instruction to do something.
for: Intended to belong to or be used by someone.
it: Referring to a thing previously mentioned or easily identified.
be: Exist or occur in the specified form or condition.
kept: Maintained or preserved in good condition.
and: Used to connect words, phrases, or clauses that have the same grammatical function.
maintained: Preserve or retain in the same state or condition.
source: A place, person, or thing from which something originates or can be obtained.
control: The power to influence or direct people's behavior or the course of events.
While: At the same time; on the other hand.
steps: A movement made by lifting one foot and putting it down in a different place.
involved: Included as part of a larger group or process.
are: Exist or occur in a certain place or situation.
more: Greater in amount, number, or size.
less: A smaller amount of; not as much.
previously: At an earlier or preceding time; before.
used: Employed for a purpose or used to do something.
task: A piece of work to be done or undertaken.
groups: A number of people or things that are located, gathered, or classed together.
they: Referring to two or more people or things previously mentioned or easily identified.
made: Past participle of 'make', created or formed by putting parts together.
generic: Applicable or suitable for various purposes or scenarios.
become: Begin to be or come to be.
reusable: Able to be used again or repeatedly.
addition: The action or process of adding something to something else.
of: Expressing the relationship between a part and a whole.
parameter: A factor that determines or is used to determine the characteristics or properties of a system.
two: Equivalent to the sum of one and one; one less than three.
This: Used to identify a specific person or thing close at hand or being indicated or experienced.
document: A piece of written, printed, or electronic matter that provides information or evidence or that serves as an official record.
cover: Deal with or address a particular subject or range of subjects.
all: Used to refer to the whole quantity or extent of a particular group or thing.
each: Every one of two or more people or things considered individually.
run: Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
located: Situated in a particular place or position.
here: In, at, or to this place or position.
